commentary.text: Back for the chase
Ojha to Smith,no run,angled full down the pad, and pops up on the off side as he misses it
Ojha to Smith,no run,pushed back to the bowler
Ojha to Smith,no run,straightens on middle, he pushes forward to defend to extra cover
Ojha to Smith,no run,very full outside off at 85 kph, he mistimes a drive to mid off
Ojha to Smith,no run,quicker on a length now, pushed to extra cover
Ojha to Smith,no run,a maiden to start off from Ojha, this one comes straight on and is tapped to cover, Smith is not getting the single
Khan to McCullum,no run,136.1 kph from Zaheer first up, moving in a tad from outside off, pushed away from the crease
Khan to McCullum,1 run,this was a length ball down the pad, but McCullum has found short fine leg
Khan to Smith,no run,good length and just outside off stump, pushed to extra cover
Khan to Smith,no run,nice, has him prodding close to off with a 126 kph cutter that leaves the right hander to beat him
Khan to Smith,no run,fuller on middle and leg, he plays it back to the bowler
Khan to Smith,1 run,shortish now and he tries to pull but it falls onto the pitch and they take the single
Ojha to Smith, $$SIX$$ ,there is long on but Smith has carted this overpitched delivery way over him
Ojha to Smith,no run,straightens from a good length on off and is guided towards point
Ojha to Smith,no run,appeal for leg before as he misses a sweep, umpire Erasmus shakes his head, could have been high
Ojha to Smith, $$SIX$$ ,quick and wide outside off, Smith reaches for it and slogs it straight and flat, no chance for long on again
Ojha to Smith,no run,goes back on a length ball to punch to extra cover
Ojha to Smith,1 run,works this off the pad to deep midwicket
Khan to Smith, $$SIX$$ ,Zaheer overpitches early in the over and is slammed into the sightscreen with a powerful swipe from Smith
Khan to Smith,1 run,works a back of a length ball to midwicket
Khan to McCullum,no run,flat-bats a back of a length ball to mid off, not enough room
Khan to McCullum,2 runs,shorter and he cuts it quickly past backward point, sweeper gets to it
Khan to McCullum, $$FOUR$$ ,shot, McCullum has blitzed this length ball on the up, splitting the gap between extra cover and mid off
Khan to McCullum, $$FOUR$$ ,now the pull, this wasn't too short, but McCullum was so quick to swivel and launch it over midwicket
Sam: "The first maiden was deliberate, it was Dwayne paying respect to his old side. Back to business after that!"
Malinga comes on
Malinga to Smith,1 run,a length ball moving in a tad to leg, nudged square
Ramesh: "Two good overs followed by two bad ones. Good balance that."
Malinga to McCullum,1 wide,slung full and down the leg side at 137 kph
Malinga to McCullum,1 leg bye,slower one down the pad, McCullum tries to nudge it fine, but it runs weakly to short fine leg
Malinga to Smith,1 run,adjusts to dab this slower good length ball to backward point
Malinga to McCullum,no run,squeezes an overpitched ball outside off to the bowler
Malinga to McCullum,no run,leans forward to defend a pitched up ball, 119 kph, down the track
Malinga to McCullum,1 run,McCullum misses out again, this was a full toss angled in, he tries to work it past short fine leg again, but cannot time it well enough beat the man
Anderson to McCullum, $$FOUR$$ ,McCullum cracks the first ball - a slow and wide length ball - from his young New Zealand allrounder flat over extra cover
Anderson to McCullum,no run,that went through, full and moving in just a bit, McCullum heaves outside the line and is beaten, the ball goes in the small gap between bat and the stumps
Anderson to McCullum,no run,charges out, Anderson bowls it much wider out of McCullum's reach
Anderson to McCullum, $$FOUR$$ ,cracked through the covers again, Anderson bowls a good length ball just outside off, there is a sweeper but McCullum has just too much power
Keeper standing up

Anderson to McCullum,2 runs, $$dropped$$ , nearly got him there, McCullum hammered this widish length ball in the air, Pollard leaped to his right at mid off, stretching to get one hand to the ball but it was travelling too fast
Anderson to McCullum, $$FOUR$$ ,length outside off and McCullum turns sweeper cover into a spectator again with his incredible bat speed
Ojha to Smith, $$SIX$$ ,another over begins with a six, Smith fetches this full one from outside off and slogs it over deep midwicket

Ojha to Smith, $$OUT$$ ,Smith's holed out this time, he looked to slog another wide ball, the mishit swirled over cover, Anderson ran in a long way from the sweeper position, and slid forward to take it
Saroj : "What a partnership !!! One hits only 4s , another hits only 6s"
Ojha to McCullum,1 run,jumps across to work this length ball to vacant midwicket
Ojha to Raina,1 run,nudged off the pad to fine leg
Ojha to McCullum,1 run,punches this bouncing length ball to sweeper cover off the back foot
Ojha to Raina,no run,skips out and pushes it back to the bowler

Harbhajan Singh to McCullum,no run,McCullum has made up his mind about the reverse sweep, Harbhajan flights this full towards leg, McCullum still plays the shot, it rolls to short third man, and he has to abandon his attempt at a single
Harbhajan Singh to McCullum,1 run
Harbhajan Singh to Raina,no run,Raina comes out to a tossed up full ball and converts it into a yorker, digs it out
Harbhajan Singh to Raina, $$OUT$$ ,Raina keeps coming out, Harbhajan pushes this straight and on a length outside off, Raina misses it and is stumped by miles
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,no run,flighted full on the stumps, he tried to nudge it to leg, ended up playing it back
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,1 run,turned past midwicket's slide for a single
Raghu Ifmr: "Are CSK trying to do a RCB here.. "
Ojha to du Plessis,no run,runs a tossed up ball to point
Ojha to du Plessis,no run,leading edge to extra cover as he pushes forward trying to work it to leg
Ojha to du Plessis,1 run,comes out to turn it to vacant midwicket for a single
Ojha to McCullum,no run,punches off the back foot to extra cover
Ojha to McCullum,1 run,slaps this flatter one off the back foot, Anderson throws himself to his left at extra cover
Ojha to du Plessis,1 run,walks out to a tossed up wide one to push it to long off
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,1 wide,angled full and way down the leg side even as du Plessis makes some room
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,2 runs,opens the face and runs this through third man for a couple
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,1 run,leaves the crease to work it off the pad to short fine
Harbhajan Singh to McCullum, $$SIX$$ ,not too short, McCullum reacts at the last instant but his bat speed is so fast, he hammers this over deep midwicket
Harbhajan Singh to McCullum,no run,full outside off, reverse swept to short third man
Harbhajan Singh to McCullum,no run,full around off, pushed back
Harbhajan Singh to McCullum,1 run
Malinga brought back
Malinga to McCullum,no run,guides a slower length ball to point
Malinga to McCullum,no run,another slower one, he leans forward and pushes it to extra cover
Malinga to McCullum,no run,full at 135 kph now, knocked back to the bowler
Malinga to McCullum,no run,a 121 kph low full toss, he almost hits it back to Malinga, falls short

Malinga to McCullum,1 run,McCullum drives a full delivery, Tare does well to go sprawling to his left at mid off, McCullum wants a second, he is well out of his crease but Tare has already thrown it to the striker's end, and McCullum escapes
Malinga to du Plessis,1 run,driven down the ground for a single
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,no run,makes room outside leg, Harbhajan follows him, he knocks it to midwicket
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,no run,goes back to a fuller one and punches to extra cover
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,no run,down the track to a flighted one, cannot work it past midwicket
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,1 run,makes more room and scythes a full toss to short third man, McCullum is quick and makes it across
Harbhajan Singh to McCullum, $$FOUR$$ ,charges out, Harbhajan bowls it shorter, but McCullum goes through with the shot with all his momentum and hammers it over the bowler
Harbhajan Singh to McCullum,2 runs,makes some room to squeeze this quick and low full toss wide of the sweeper
Pollard to du Plessis,1 run,moves across to a full one and works it to deep square leg
Pollard to McCullum, $$FOUR$$ ,delivers a high full toss into the right hander, and McCullum whips it inches inside the deep square leg rope
Pollard to McCullum,1 run,overpitched ball driven to long off
Pollard to du Plessis,1 run,turns this slow length ball from around off to short fine
Pollard to McCullum,1 run,another slower one, it bounces and hits the bat high as McCullum drops it into the off side to reach his fifty with a single
Pollard to du Plessis,2 runs,fine drive through extra cover, long off is around but McCullum races back for the second
Zaheer round the stumps
Khan to McCullum,no run,charges out and has a heave, misses the delivery which bounces just over the stumps
Khan to McCullum, $$SIX$$ ,he's waiting to use the angle into him this time, not too short, but he gets under it and swings it high, and comfortably clear of deep square leg
Khan to McCullum,no run,tries to pull this slow and wide but is beaten
Khan to McCullum,1 run,length ball into leg stump, McCullum makes room and squeezes it to point
Khan to du Plessis,no run,goes outside off and gets too close to the line of this length ball to be able to time his shot, hits it to extra cover
Khan to du Plessis,2 runs,length ball swiped behind square on the leg side with the angle
Time out
Malinga to McCullum,1 run,flashes a drive at a full away swinging delivery, sweeper cover fields
Malinga to du Plessis,no run,chops this back of a length ball to point
Malinga to du Plessis,no run,skips out to this full toss but is beaten by the slight away shape, which also takes it just past off
Malinga to du Plessis,1 run,drags a full delivery from off to long on
Malinga to McCullum,no run,now McCullum is beaten on the drive with a sharp and full outswinger just outside off
Malinga to McCullum,1 run,gets some bat on the drive for a single wide of cover
Harbhajan Singh to McCullum,1 run,charges out to a full delivery and flashes it to the sweeper
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,2 runs,Pollard drops a  $$sitter$$ , du Plessis skied this slog-sweep to a tossed up delivery, Pollard ran in from deep midwicket and clanged it
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,2 runs,turned through midwicket along the ground, McCullum has to dive back on the second, throw misses
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis,1 run,another slog-sweep, falls short of deep midwicket this time

Harbhajan Singh to McCullum,1 run,another  $$chance$$ , but a very difficult one, McCullum lofts in the direction of long off, who runs in some way, dives forward, but does not make it, falls just short
Harbhajan Singh to du Plessis, $$OUT$$ ,Faf is gone this time, he lunges out and misses a flighted ball, keeper does not, Harbhajan is pumped up
Khan to McCullum,1 run,drives a full one to long off
Round the stumps
Khan to Dhoni,no run,shuffles to outside off, pushes a length ball to Zaheer
Khan to Dhoni,2 leg byes,appeal for leg before as Dhoni misses the nudge to leg, but there is too much angle, there is a direct hit too, but McCullum is home, they take another for the ricochet
Khan to Dhoni,1 leg bye,he's hit on the pad again as he comes out to this length ball
over the stumps
Khan to McCullum,1 run,worked off the pad to deep square leg
Khan to Dhoni,1 run,Dhoni gets bat to ball this time to turn this length ball to midwicket
Malinga has only one over left, Pollard is holding the ball, and after a discussion that includes Rohit and Harbhajan, he hands it to Malinga
Malinga to Dhoni,no run,McCullum had given up, Dhoni whipped a full one to midwicket, Hussey picked it up and released it quickly, McCullum was way out of his ground, but Hussey missed
Malinga to Dhoni,1 no ball,knocks a full delivery to the bowler, who parries it to the leg side, they don't get the single, but Malinga has overstepped, tight call by umpire Bowden
Malinga to Dhoni, $$SIX$$ ,Dhoni goes deep in the crease to a full delivery and helicopters it over deep midwicket
Malinga to Dhoni,1 run,full again, hit down the ground to long on

Malinga to McCullum, $$FOUR$$ ,needed a dive at sweeper cover, but not only is Zaheer slow in running across, he also does not dive to concede a boundary, McCullum flayed it with an open face over extra cover
Malinga to McCullum,no run,around the blockhole, he digs it out to midwicket
Malinga to McCullum,1 run,low full toss eased to long on
Anderson to McCullum,1 run,cuts a widish one to sweeper cover
Anderson to Dhoni, $$FOUR$$ ,Anderson sends this length ball down the pads, and Dhoni does not miss out
Anderson to Dhoni,1 run,forced down to long on for one more
Anderson to McCullum,1 run,drives an overpitched ball to long on
round the wicket
Anderson to Dhoni,1 run,pulls a short ball to fine leg
over the stumps
Anderson to McCullum,1 run,McCullum brings CSK home as he swipes this wide of deep midwicket
That is all for tonight. Good bye

Mohit Sharma is the Man of the Match. Mohit: "Captain said 'wicket was on the slower side, don't bowl the same pace, mix it up, it is hard to hit the slower one on this surface'. When you bowled quicker, the ball came on and was easier to hit. It was not easy to hit when you mix up your pace. We bowled well at the death and they were not able to get as many as they would have wanted to. But 140 was still a good score. McCullum and Smith batted well. The wickets here are similar to India."

$$Dhoni$$ : "The death bowling was superb. In the middle overs they had a partnership going which meant we were under a bit of pressure which meant the bowlers had to step up. We were not sure how the wicket would play in the second half. Last game we played here we realised the slower one works really well, you had to hit the right areas which Mohit did. If Dwayne Smith gets going, McCullum takes a backseat, and if there is a change in momentum, McCullum takes charge. They have complemented each other very well. Following them we have got Raina, du Plessis, we have good firepower to capitalise."

$$Rohit$$ : "That was the target, unfortunately we could not get to 160, I was a little disappointed. Did not start well, batted well in the middle but did not finish off well. Was a good batting track. 140 was not a big target. In the last three games we have not scored more than 140 which shows there is some work to do there. Bowlers have done well in all the three games."
MI just cannot get their batting going, and are the only team without a win after three matches

SD: "The critical difference between the two teams today was that McCullum stayed there till the end, while Rohit, Mumbai's batting mainstay, didn't. Of course, Mohit's exceptional bowling has to be accounted for, but Mumbai might have competed better with a few more balls of Rohit, especially towards the end. It's terrible to see the defending champion fare so poorly."

name: Chennai Super Kings v Mumbai Indians
